div.p:
svasti śrī kovirājarājakecariva
nmarkku yāṇṭu Eṭṭāvatu Aṭikaḷ paḻuveṭṭaraiyar kaṇṭan maṟavanār paṭai Iḷai
ya Iraṇamukarāmanil kaikkoḷan palatevan vaiyiriyai kunṟakūṟṟattu mallūr
irukku veḷḷāḷan kiḻavan ṉampanum palatevaṉai vayiriyum taṅkaḷil Uruvik kutti pa
la[tevan va]yiri paṭak kiḻavan nampanai Aṭikaḷ paḻuveṭṭaraiyar kaṇṭan maṟavanār ci
ṟupaḻuvūr tiruvālantuṟai Uṭaiyamahādevarkku Ivanai cātti Oru nontāvi
ḷakku vaiy enna vaitta cāvāmūvāp perāṭu toṇṇūṟu Ittoṇṇūṟum vaic
cenpanmāyeśvara rakṣai ||

Fortune! Prosperity! This is the eighth year of Kōvirājarājakesarivarman. The Kaikkōḷan Palatēvan Vaiyiri, who is in Iraṇamukarāman,This is a part of the name of the donor of thebalipīṭha in the southern shrine of the AIM (#26). It may be the name of a specific branch of the army of the Paḻuvēṭṭaraiyar. the young iḷaiya [branch?] of the army paṭai of Aṭikaḷ Paḻuvēṭṭaraiyar Kaṇṭan Maṟavanār; Nampan, lord kiḻavan [and] Veḷḷāḷan (agriculturalist) who resides irukkum in Mallūr in Kuṉṟakkūṟṟam (kunṟakūṟṟam > kuṉṟakkūṟṟam) and Palatēvan Vayiri; between them taṅkaḷil, Palatēvan Vayiri having drawn uruvi [the sword] pierced kutti the lord kiḻavan Nampan so that he dies paṭa; Aṭikaḷ Paḻuvēṭṭaraiyar Kaṇṭan Maṟavanār said enna: “put vai one perpetual lamp oru nontāviḷakku on behalf of him cātti ivaṉai to Mahādeva who possesses/of uṭaiya Tiruvālantuṟai of Ciṟupaḻuvūr”; ninety toṇṇūṟu undying and non-ageing great goats cāvāmūva perāṭu were placed vaitta [for this lamp]; I have put vaiccēn these ninety ittoṇṇūṟum [goats]. This is under the protection of the Panmāheśvaras.
Edited and translated in , based on autopsy and photographs (by Valérie Gillet, 2016-2018).
